tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE editorial_calendar (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  content_title VARCHAR(255),
  publication_date DATE,
  author_name VARCHAR(100),
  status VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE EditorialCalendars (
    calendar_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    publisher_id UUID,
    calendar_name TEXT,
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE ContentSchedules (
    schedule_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    calendar_id UUID,
    content_id UUID,
    schedule_date DATE,
    status TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE PublishedContent (
    content_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    title TEXT,
    content TEXT,
    publish_date DATE,
    publisher_id UUID
);
